ai-ud7.7:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud7.7:1.3_0: Now at that time the Buddha was sitting reviewing his own giving up of the concepts of identity that emerge from the proliferation of perceptions.
ai-ud7.7:2.1_0: Then, understanding his own giving up of the concepts of identity that emerge from the proliferation of perceptions, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud7.7:3.1_0: “There is no proliferation remaining in them,
ai-ud7.7:3.2_0: the reins and bar are escaped;
ai-ud7.7:3.3_0: the sage who lives without craving
ai-ud7.7:3.4_0: is never scorned by the world with its gods.”
